title: Do you prefer to write in first person, or in third person? If so, why? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends entirely on what I’m writing about. If I am describing my personal experience or my point of view, I would certainly write in first person, because it authenticates the story. If I am describing a situation for someone, as though we could share the experience, or if I’m using a metaphor or analogy to illustrate a point, I might use third person. I find it engages and enrolls people in the experience, so they can give feedback. My preferences are that people can relate to an experience. The kind of writing I do is not usually just telling a story, but more teaching or training as I am a coach. If I am describing a situation for someone as though they could experience it for themselves, I might use third person. Commonly, I use both, as I involve the person, but also relate my own experience to help them know that I understand what they’re talking about.

Third person for fiction and first person for non-fiction. Because when I’m writing fiction, my characters are separate from me, and have their own thoughts, feelings and responses. When I am writing non-fiction, unless otherwise attributed, my opinions are my own, and that should be clear to the reader.
First-person. It’s a habit, and I like being able to share how the character looks at things. I often have two main characters, and go back and forth between their perspectives each chapter.
